org.xchain

Class StandAloneExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xchain.StandAloneExecutor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Executor
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    StandAloneHibernateExecutor

    public class StandAloneExecutor
extends java.lang.Object
implements Executor

    Bootstraps the environment for executing an XChain. It used an XML configuration file for determining what catalog to use and which commands to execute.

    Author:
    Josh Kennedy

        Returns:

      • loadProperties

        protected static boolean loadProperties(java.util.Properties properties,
                     java.lang.String[] args)
        Attempts to load properties based off of the three methods to define where a configuration file is. First it will try the "standard" configuration placement "./executor.xml", then it will look for a jvm property CONFIGURATION_SYSTEM_PROPERTY, and finally it will check to see if a file name was passed in
        Parameters:
        properties - Properties Object to use
        args - Arguments passed in from the command line
        Returns:

      • loadPropertiesFromFile

        protected static boolean loadPropertiesFromFile(java.lang.String name,
                             java.util.Properties properties)
        Attempts to load the properties from both the regular file system, as well as from the contents of the class loader. If there are files in both locations they will both be loaded into the properties, the file system takes precedence.
        Parameters:
        name - file name
        properties - properties object to load file into
        Returns:

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
